meanings.sent1: The loyal dog was subservient to its owner's every command.
meanings.sent2: In the fairy tale, the subservient princess always followed the queen's orders.
meanings.sent3: The robot's subservient behavior made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The subservient soldier carried out his duties with unwavering dedication.
meanings.sent5: The subservient student eagerly completed all the tasks assigned by the teacher.

meanings.sent1: The subservient role of the sidekick often goes unnoticed in movies.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a subservient member of the team, always in the background.
meanings.sent3: The subservient little squirrel tried to lead the forest animals in a dance.
meanings.sent4: The subservient moonlight dimmed in comparison to the bright sun.
meanings.sent5: The subservient actor played a minor role in the play, but did it well.

meanings.definition: Serving as a means to an end.
meanings.sent1: The subservient tool was essential for completing the project.
meanings.sent2: His subservient attitude towards networking helped him advance in his career.
meanings.sent3: The subservient spoon eagerly stirred the soup in the pot.
meanings.sent4: The subservient bridge connected the two sides of the river seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The subservient key unlocked the mysterious door to reveal a hidden treasure.
